current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To establish a Federal tax credit approximation matching
		  program for State new jobs training tax credits, and for other
		  purposes.

text.#text: For purposes of this section, the term

the State income
			 taxes withheld by the employer on behalf of the eligible trainee, once employed
			 by the employer, to the extent they do not exceed the cost of qualified
			 training specified in such contract, will not be remitted to the State in
			 payment of income taxes, but will be remitted to the eligible community
			 college,

the amounts so

			 payment for education provided by such community college, and

for purposes of
			 determining the State income tax liability of the eligible trainee, the amounts
			 so remitted will be treated as if they had been remitted to the State in
			 payment of income taxes owed by the eligible trainee.

the eligible community college will not charge tuition or fees to such individuals,

term.#tail:
means education or training which, if completed, will provide
			 the individual with—

text.#text: For purposes of this section, the term

education or
			 skills necessary to perform the job for which such individual will be
			 employed,

education or
			 skills necessary to obtain a license required under Federal, State, or local
			 governmental regulation for the employment of the individual in the job for
			 which such individual will be employed,

a certificate or
			 credential which is required under Federal, State, or local governmental
			 regulation for the employment of the individual in the job for which such
			 individual will be employed, or

a certificate or
			 credential aligned with national or regionally recognized industry standards
			 determined appropriate by the State.

is a new job (which, for purposes of this paragraph,  may include a new position within an existing job category), and 
			 not a job of a recalled worker, a replacement job, or any other job that
			 existed in the employer's business within the 1-year period preceding the date
			 of hire,

is
			 not a job that existed in a business operation or substantially similar
			 business operation of the employer formerly located in another location which
			 was closed or substantially reduced by the employer, and

results in a
			 net increase in employment for the employer.

A State program will not be treated as a State new jobs
			 training tax credit program for purposes of this subsection unless the program
			 provides that, in order to be eligible to participate, the employer must show
			 with respect to each eligible trainee that such eligible trainee is hired for a
			 job that—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
,
			 only employees at job sites located in the United States (including the
			 possessions of the United States) shall be taken into account.
